Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can draw a simple fish shape in a water setting. *(basic drawing skill)*
The student can label the fish with a simple label such as 'fish'. *(emerging labeling skill)*
The student can include one or two other features like a plant or another fish, but with minimal detail. *(basic addition of elements)*
CANNOT: The student may not accurately label the water or might forget to label it entirely. *(labeling incomplete)*
The student struggles to show or label how the fish uses the water habitat to meet its needs. *(student doesnâ€™t understand function of habitat)*
The student might draw other living things but may not correctly identify them as part of the habitat. *(misunderstands habitat roles)*
The student is unlikely to show how different parts of the habitat work together to support the fish and other living things. *(lack of understanding of interactions)*
